value: A classic Plainfield mansion, home of former Governor McGreevy

In the early 20th century, Plainfield was a getaway from
and a place of residence for the rich and famous, and there are still many buildings in town that reflect its former history. Unfortunately, Plainfield was affected by the riots that centered on
in the 60s and became a victim of white flight and economic depression. Recently, there have been efforts to restore some of the town's former grandeur.
The NJ Transit Raritan Valley Line stops at Plainfield's historic train station, which is on the National Register of Historic Places in the United States.
You are best off with a car.

value: File:Dutch Colonial Revival house in Plainfield, New Jersey.jpg
A Dutch revival house built in 1923

Drive around and see the mansions of yesteryear.

value: Plainfield Firehouse No 4, which is on the National Register of Historic Places in the United States

Plainfield still has an iffy reputation for safety, so take sensible precautions when visiting.
